intro: Galium dumetorum, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a low-growing herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are usually prostrate or ascending, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Galium dumetorum is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through rhizomes or seeds.
